In anticipation of German occupation, the Government of Belgium left Brussels on

chief.note: Embassy Brussels was closed on July 15, 1940; Cudahy left post on July 18, 1940. Rudolph E. Schoenfeld was designated on November 1, 1940, to serve as Chargé d’Affaires ad interim near the Government of Belgium established in England.
Served as Chargé d’Affaires ad interim near the Government of Belgium established in England.

ended.note: Government of Belgium in England terminated on
